comment: Where do I input my location? I clicked the settings icon, but nowhere does it ask for location. And the app on my watch is asking me to open the host app and do so. Kind of confused.
title: Looks awesome, but one problem ...

author: Anthony Coyle
comment: This is one of my most used Wear apps and is an excellent example of what the platform can be used for. Very smooth, fluid, and informative. I love seeing the names of the different constellations when I stand in front of them and the planet locations. A must for anyone with an interest in the Cosmos.
title: Awesome

author: Craig Ueltzen
comment: Neat app. Well worth the download. Your location is derived from your phone. You'll need the GPS turned on.

author: KS Lam
comment: No response, can not open the chart

reply.author: Dirk Farin
reply.content: This app is for the android watch, not for an android phone.

title: Only the quick instruction shows up

author: David Evans
comment: Great little app for my Moto 360 and absolutely free. 5 stars!
title: Works well!

author: Sean McShane
comment: How do I get it on my watch?

reply.author: Dirk Farin
reply.content: When the watch is paired with the phone, it is pushed automatically to the watch. You start it via the app-launcher on the watch.

title: Can't get it on my watch

author: colin x
comment: Works great on my zenwatch 2. I really like how simple it is. Thanks!

author: Richard Foss
comment: Still getting the hang of it, may upgrade to five stars by the end of the week, if it keeps working this smooth.
title: I like this app

author: Ning Zhao
comment: For star watching hobbyists a nice companion!
title: Smart features and easy to use
